title.narrative: Intersex Persons Implementation Coordination Committee (IPICC) Strengthened

description.narrative: The Commission was represented in The Task force on Policy, Legal, Institutional and Administrative Reforms regarding Intersex Persons . Notably, the Task force completed its report, launched and submitted the same to the Hon AG. To support the implementation of the recommendations, the Hon Attorney General established the Intersex Implementation Coordination Committee (IPICC) to oversee the implementation of the recommendations in the report. The Commission is both Chair and Secretariat of the committee.

title.narrative: Improved access to and timely processing of human rights complaints, with particular attention to SGBV cases

description.narrative: The KNCHR in line with its statutory and constitutional mandate receive and process complaints on alleged human rights violations. Complaints that fall within the KNCHR’s mandate are subjected to further analysis and follow up that includes among others investigations. Complaints that fall outside the KNCHR’s mandate are referred to relevant complaints handling institutions for further action.

title.narrative: ADR entrenched as a mechanism for resolving legal disputes and human rights complaints

description.narrative: The KNCHR is empowered under article 252 of the Constitution and Section 29 of the KNCHR Act to apply Alternative Dispute Resolution (ADR) mechanisms (Negotiation, conciliation and mediation) in resolution of appropriate cases. ADR presents a less acrimonious, faster, more flexible and cheaper party driven mode of access to justice to the parties.

title.narrative: Systemic human rights violations resolved through Public Interest Litigation

description.narrative: The KNCHR is mandated under Article 59 of the Constitution and Section 8 of KNCHR Act to take steps to secure appropriate redress where violations are disclosed to have happened. Public Interest Litigation (PIL) is one of the means by which the Commission is able to influence policy direction and interpretation of the Constitution through the judicial process. It also serves as a mechanism for the resolving human rights violations. The Commission participates in PIL through either originating petitions in its own name or joining existing petitions filed by other parties which have a major public interest component either as amicus curiae or an interested party as appropriate.

title.narrative: A victim-centered human rights based approach (HRBA) integrated in the delivery of justice

description.narrative: This objective will aim to intensify the advocacy for Human Rights Based Approach (HRBA) in delivery of justice. In doing so, the National Commission is to adopt the following approaches: Capacity building of justice actors; trial observations & targeted court observations; strengthening the legal capacity for persons with disabilities and advocacy for establishment and actualization of reparations mechanism.
